text:
The wrapper script <ant>/bin/ant.bat contains a condition in order to identify the 4nt 
shell

line 18
rem Need to check if we are using the 4NT shell...
if "%eval[2+2]" == "4" goto 
setup4NT

But this condition is also true under the standard cmd-shell under Win NT4 (SP6)
so 
that the following expression (set ANT_CMD_LINE_ARGS=%*) is also executed under 4NT which is 
erroneous. After that, it's impossible to start any task/target under 4NT.
creator: dominik.hirt@encorus.com
bodewig@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 3654 ***

creator: dominik.hirt@encorus.com
text:
Solution:

the condition in line 18 of <ant>/bin/ant.bat must be:

if "%@eval[2 + 2]%" == 
"4" goto setup4NT

instead of
if "%eval[2+2]" == "4" goto setup4NT
